intro: Plectocomia griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's plectocomia, is a rare and striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like India and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often deeply lobed and have a distinctive, almost fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces berries that are red when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
